Permitting issues: Obtaining the necessary permits from local authorities can be a time-consuming and complicated process, which can lead to project delays.
Labor shortages: Finding enough skilled labor to work on the project can be a challenge, especially if the project requires specialized skills.
Supply chain disruptions: Delays in the delivery of materials and equipment can cause project delays and increase costs.
Weather-related issues: Unfavorable weather conditions, such as heavy rain or snow, can cause construction delays and increase safety risks.
Design flaws: Design errors or inadequate design can lead to structural issues and safety hazards, which can result in costly repairs or even project failure.
